title.value: Harmony in Diversity: Merging Neural Networks with Canonical Correlation Analysis
title.justification: The title provides a clear identification of the research paper, emphasizing the primary contribution which is merging neural networks using Canonical Correlation Analysis.
title.quote: H ARMONY IN D IVERSITY: M ERGING N EURAL N ETWORKS WITH C ANONICAL C ORRELATION A NALYSIS

extractions.description: The paper proposes a model merging method, CCA Merge, based on Canonical Correlation Analysis to enhance the performance of merged neural networks by maximizing correlations between model features. It addresses the challenges of merging models trained on varying data and initial conditions, showing improvements over existing permutation-based approaches.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments comparing the CCA Merge method to other existing methods across various model architectures and datasets, demonstrating improved performance.
type.quote: We compare our CCA Merge to past works and find that it yields better performing merged models across a variety of architectures and dataset.

name.justification: The paper focuses on merging neural network models to improve performance and reduce computational costs, fitting under the broader category of model fusion.
name.quote: Model fusion, which combines parameters from multiple models into one, aims to mitigate these costs but faces practical challenges.

name.justification: The proposed method, CCA Merge, is based on Canonical Correlation Analysis, making this a significant subfield in the study.
name.quote: We propose a new model merging algorithm, CCA Merge, which is based on Canonical Correlation Analysis.

name.justification: The paper discusses and approaches challenges related to ensembles and model averaging.
name.quote: Ensembling multiple models enhances predictive performance by utilizing the varied learned features of the different models.

name.justification: The challenges and methods proposed relate to optimizing neural network parameter settings post-training for improved merger outcomes.
name.quote: Model fusion... faces challenges in maintaining performance... these minima are most often separated by regions of high loss.

name.justification: CCA Merge is the newly proposed model merging algorithm in the paper.
name.quote: Our main contributions are threefold: (1) We propose a new model merging method based on Canonical Correlation Analysis (Sec. 3) which we will refer to as “CCA Merge”.

is_contributed.justification: The method CCA Merge is introduced and evaluated in this paper as a novel approach.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a new model merging algorithm, CCA Merge.

is_executed.justification: Experiment results using CCA Merge are presented in tables and graphs, indicating execution of the model.
is_executed.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged VGG11, ResNet20 and ResNet18 models... for CCA Merge.

is_compared.justification: CCA Merge is compared to various existing model merging methods throughout the study.
is_compared.quote: We compare CCA Merge with the following methods: Direct averaging, Permute, Matching Weights, ZipIt!.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference is made to support the theoretical foundation of CCA used in CCA Merge.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For more details we direct the reader to the appendix and to De Bie et al. (2005) from which this section was inspired.

name.justification: ResNet18 is one of the architectures used for testing and comparing the performance of the CCA Merge method.
name.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged... ResNet18 models of different widths trained on CIFAR10, CIFAR100 and ImageNet200.

is_contributed.justification: ResNet18 is used for testing but not introduced or improved in a novel way by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged... ResNet18 models of different widths

is_executed.justification: Experimental results involving ResNet18 show that the model was executed as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: ResNet18 on ImageNet200 - Accuracies and standard deviations from 4 different merges... are presented.

is_compared.justification: Comparative results on merging methods involving ResNet18 are provided, comparing CCA Merge to other strategies.
is_compared.quote: We compare CCA Merge with the following methods... for ResNet18 on ImageNet200.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is a foundational reference for the ResNet architecture, used as part of the research comparison.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ResNet20 and ResNet18 (He et al., 2016)... models.

name.justification: ResNet20 is specifically mentioned as one of the models evaluated using the proposed CCA Merge technique.
name.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged... ResNet20 and ResNet18 models.

is_contributed.justification: ResNet20 is utilized for experimentation but not newly developed or contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged... ResNet20 and ResNet18 models.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes experimental evaluations using ResNet20, indicating it was run during the study.
is_executed.quote: ResNet20 on CIFAR100 - Accuracies and standard deviations from 4 different merges of 2 models are presented.

is_compared.justification: ResNet20 is part of the comparative evaluations against various model merging methods.
is_compared.quote: We compare CCA Merge with the following methods... for ResNet20 on CIFAR100.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The ResNet paper forms the basis for the employed architecture in comparative studies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ResNet20 and ResNet18 (He et al., 2016)... models.

name.justification: The paper discusses the merging of VGG11 models using the CCA Merge method, indicating its use in the experiments.
name.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged VGG11... models of different widths trained on CIFAR10.

is_contributed.justification: While VGG11 is used for testing, it is not a novel contribution of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: VGG11 models merged with CCA Merge have significantly higher accuracies...

is_executed.justification: VGG11 was actively used in testing the CCA Merge approach, as shown by the results provided.
is_executed.quote: VGG11 models merged with CCA Merge have significantly higher accuracies...

is_compared.justification: The results using VGG11 include comparisons with other methods, showcasing its role in the evaluations.
is_compared.quote: In Table 1 we show the test accuracies of merged VGG11... models of different widths.

referenced_paper_title.value: Very Deep Convolutional Networks for Large-Scale Image Recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: VGG11 is based on this reference, defining the underlying architecture used in the research.

name.justification: CIFAR10 is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for training and evaluating models with CCA Merge.
name.quote: The models were trained on CIFAR10.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning Multiple Layers of Features from Tiny Images
referenced_paper_title.justification: This classic reference is used to justify the employment of CIFAR10 in the experiments.

name.justification: The dataset CIFAR100 is used extensively in the experiments focusing on testing model merging strategies including CCA Merge.
name.quote: ResNet20... models of different widths trained on... CIFAR100 for CCA Merge.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning Multiple Layers of Features from Tiny Images
referenced_paper_title.justification: This foundational reference supports the application of CIFAR100 in the study's experiments.

name.justification: ImageNet200 is discussed as another dataset used to evaluate the merging method CCA Merge.
name.quote: ResNet18... models of different widths trained on... ImageNet200 for CCA Merge.

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference paper is key for ImageNet, from which ImageNet200 is selected as a subset.

name.justification: MNIST is indirectly referenced in relation to previous model merging methods highlighting its common use in benchmarking.
name.quote: focus on easy settings such as MLPs on MNIST or they fine-tune the resulting merged model.

referenced_paper_title.value: Gradient-based learning applied to document recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The MNIST dataset is a well-documented dataset referenced in various learning applications, including this paper's context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: easy settings such as MLPs on MNIST
